column1: Hi. My husband and I are due to arrive in Funchal on Friday 24th July and will be staying at Pestana Carlton. I’m looking forward to it but must admit also a bit nervous. I am aware everyone is tested when they arrive and I have filled in the questionnaire online. Would someone be able to explain the arrival process for me? Do we have to go straight to our hotel room and wait there until we get a negative result? We arrive at lunchtime so does that mean we won’t be able to go out to eat or buy food until the following day? Also what happens if one of us happened to test positive? Would we then be separated? Thanks.
Here's the official video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZEKT2SfnXjM

What that video doesn't tell you is what happens if one or both of you prove positive for Covid-19 after the airport test. As I understand it, health officials will be in contact and both of you may be taken to a government approved quarantine resort/hotel. I doubt that you will be separated because if one of you proves positive then the other person has been in very close contact and is a potential riskAs regards the up to 12 hours in the Pestana Carlton waiting for your results, I believe you can leave your room and use the hotel's bar and food facilities but you should not leave the hotel for shopping or other purposes.If anyone knows any different perhaps they will post here.

The testing process has been put in place since the 1st of July and we have had dozens of international flights since then and everything seems to be going smoothly up to the moment. When you get to the airport there is a blue line (if you don´t have a test) and a green line (if tou have a test). There are some "stweardesses" that can guide you through the process if you need help.There is no quarantine in place while waiting for the test result, but people are asked to self isolate as possible while waiting for the result. You can still buy food obviously. The point of the test is if by chance your test is positive the authorities can trace the people who have had direct contact with yourself for more than just a few minutes. Hopefully in a 12h span it won´t be that many people.Regarding the case where one of you is positive for sure the other one will be asked to self isolate aswell since it is highly likely he will be infected too. I am pretty sure authorities will not ask couples to be kept apart against their will. While there were only domestic flights we have had cases of families with children where one was positive and they are were not split.Edited: 6:23 am, July 16, 2020

The protocol does not foresee that a whole plane is put in quarantine because of an infected passenger. If a passenger is infected, the health authority determines the degree of exposure of each of the remaining passengers, usually they are the passengers sitting right next (on the side and front and rear rows). These contacts are considered to be on "active surveillance" which is somewhat less restrictive than quarantine. This means they are contacted periodically to self-monitor any symptoms and advised to adopt social restriction measures. Madeira is "open" for international travel since the 1st of July, and 21'000 passengers disembarked in Madeira Airport since then of which 9 had a positive test.
